fell debate popular estate gouernement cittie beene taken people giuen small number pisander fellowes returned samos wonne •• mie obedience great part samians exhorted cheefe city take gouernment owne hand although many others sought vphold continue popular estate whence arose great contention mutiny among athenian also army hauing consulted together seeing alcibiades liked matter resolued leaue repeale sentence banishment seemed vnto hee returne citty hee would fit person bee employed vnder command small number expedient estate whereof question bethinke themselues handle worke matter neuerthelesse prosecute warre whereto readily willingly offer contribute owne money whatsoeuer el necessary knowing laboured publicke seruice state men themselues sent pisander one halfe embassadours haue gone tissaphernes backe athens take order eff • cting purpose gaue charge passed city subiect athenian commit gouernment therof cheefest halfe saied embassadours departed went purpose seuerall place farther decree diatrephes siege chio goe prouince thrace whereof ben appointed gouernour departure said siege passing thassus abolished popular estate put gouernment hand small number citizen hee gone thence part thassians hauing enclosed city wall moneth departure persuaded themselues needed longer bee gouerned athenian placed authority thereby bee subiection contrary hoping lacedemonians aide recouer within small time absolute liberty fellow citizen beene expulsed athenian gone lacedemon made great sute shippes might sent thassus city might reuolt thing fell euen according owne desire city former liberty without danger restored people bent authority rule small number without scandale depriued gouernment held athenian diotrephes made gouernours found themselues greatly deceiued issue thought expectation like done many city subiect state athens considering seemes need longer feare athenian manner liuing subiection vnder colour gouernment nothing el deed disguised shadowed kind bondage seeke true libertie touching pi • ander went owne pleasure commit gouernement city passed small number saied city tooke souldiers led athens found complices friendes already done many thing tending accomplishment purpose abolishing popular estate one androcles great authority credite people one cheefe procurer alcibiades banishment slaine priuie conspiracie certain yong men city two cause one great authoritie credite people get hereby good fauour alcibiades thought returne recouer former authoritie hoping would make tissaphernes friend cause like meanes slaine others doubted also besotted people artificiall smooth speech telling meete giue longer pay saue serued • warre administration publicke affaire ought assemble emploied fiue hundred namely able serue commonweale person purse thing generally seeme honourable euen caused restoring popular estate hoped change haue authoritie yet ancient manner continues assembling people counsell cause hearing men opinion following greater part nothing might bee propounded without deliberation little counsel whereto authority assigned conferred apart touching al matter bee propounded furtherance intent deliuered opinion none durst contradict feare seeing great number authoritie said gouernours gainesay found meanes make away obseruing forme iustice making inquisition touching murthers wherewith people amazed terrified none durst speake word thought sped well holding peace hee felt hurt violence feare much doubted farre greater number conspiracie neither desire know well greatnesse city people man knew anothers mind durst complaine reueale secret vnto talke meanes howe bee auenged feare mutuall distrust great among stood doubt euen acquaintance verie friendes fearing least conspiracie thereof whome man euer anie opinion cause knewe whome might safely trust conspirator estate greatly strengthened assured cheefly reason common diffidence pisander therefore fellowes arriued trouble easily small time atchieue purpose first hauing assembled people caused consent election tenne clearkes secretary might haue full authority power pronounce read vnto people whatsoeuer vpon due aduise thought meet bee consulted good city certaine day nominated day come people assembled great fi • ld wherein stood temple neptune tenne furlong city nothing el publickely pronounced said notary saue might bee lawfull relate report athenian decree part would whosoeuer charge relater reporter thereof therein done lawes otherwise outrage hinder greeuously punished decree pronounced tenour whereof officer receiued charge authoritie people deposed stipend bee allowed vnto chosen fiue president might afterward nominate hundred person chuse three others al foure hundred thy sate court haue full ample authoritie power ordaine execute whatsoeuer thinke good profitable commonweale besides summon assemble fiue thousand citizen oft seeme good vnto decree pronounced pisander therein thing willingly vndertake whatsoeuer hee thought serued abrogating abolishing popular estate saied decree precogitated deuised antiphon great account estimation speake truth man time whole city surpasse vertue withall aduised wise giuing counsell touching publick affaire besides excellent grace declaring propounding notwithstanding hee neuer came common assembly contentious meeting vnlesse sent although thus warie yet people suspition efficacie elegance speech albeit led priuate life would entermeddle estate yet euery one cause matter either iudgement people accounted great fauour hee might haue antiphon counsell tyrannicall estate foure hundred destroyed proceeded forme lawe principall authours thereof accused rest mine opinion farre better defend answere himselfe euer man within compasse remembrance phrynichus likewise shewed himselfe great fauouror estate feare alcibiades well assured practises knowne whereof secretly treated astiochus samos thought would neuer returne gouernment foure hundred generally accounted man constant valiant extreame distresse great aduersities high courage mind neuer knowne faile whatsoeuer danger theramenes also sonne agnon principall dealer abolishing popular estate man knowne sufficiency word deed therfore maruell enterprise plotted prosecuted many men wisdome authority successe although seemed indeed matter exceeding difficulty depriue people liberty enioyed helde hundred yeares since expulsion tyran onely exempted subiection anie also halfe time commanded country assemblie people broken vp approoued said decree foure hundred afterward brought court manner athenian continually armes reason enemy decelea wit guarded wals gate place according appointed day came assigned making act suffered conspiracie goe home house custome rest commaunded stay place wherein watch weapon lay somewhat neere thereto charge saw anie offer resist hinder purpose neede required set vpon hereunto deputed appointed andrians thenians three hundred caristians citie aegina whome athenian caused come dwell euerie thing thus ordered foure hundred chosen newe forme gouernement carrying dagger closely vnder attire •• uing sixe score young men assist aide occasion se ••• entered together pallace court kept enuironning senatours sate counsell according custome deliuered opinion white blacke beanes told take stipend time serued office depart stipend foure hundred brought went counsell chamber gaue euery man due meanes departed without making resistance neither people stirre said foure hundred entring chose number certain treasurer receiuers done offered solemne sacrifice creation said new office hereby forme popular gouernment wholly changed great part thing ben decreed done people reuoked cancelled saue restoring banished men least vertue therof alcibiades returne proceed new gouernours listed among thing put death certaine citizen doubting least substituted place seemed agreeable tyrannical humour imprisoned others banished hauing thus done sent herault agis king lacedemon decelea signifying vnto desirous reconcile themselues lacedemonians hee might haue greater assurance repose trust wauering inconstant multitude ignorant people agis thinking citie must needes bee full great discontent trouble people would easily giue ouer authoritie especially see great armie come city supposing withall estate foure hundred could yet established might shaken made answere touching agreement desired within fewe day leuied great number souldiers country peloponesus whome togither hee alreadie decelea hee brought wals athens hoping athenian would yeeld thēselues vnto well regard discontent trouble within without citie feare sight mightie power marching euen gate although hope therein faile yet seemed likely might easily take great wals force abandoned reason exceeding length could bee furnished sufficient number defendant euent cleane contrarie expectation athenian raised tumult approch sent horseman part footman throughly lightly armed forthwith driue backe came nearest wals slew part carrying spoiles city agis seeing enterprise issue expected returned decelea within fewe day sent backe discharged forraine souldiors leuied purpose keeping onely pay four hundred sent againe treat agreement whereto seemed outward shew far incline persuaded send embassadours lacedemon treating peace desired side said foure hundred sent ten citizen samos besides others thing charge commaunded declare vnto whatsoeuer beene done changing popular estate tended hurt citie good safetie therof authoritie hand foure hundred onely onely fiue thousand meanes people gouerne well sith popular state neuer present assembly great number fiue thousand person deliberating determining whatsoeuer cause whether domesticall forraine embassage sent samos four hundred presently beginning vsurpation feared fleet army would allow change obey gouernement discord mischeefe arising would spread thence city indeed time said change made athens cause mutinie sedition raised said city samos manner certain samians fauor popular estate city defence thereof risen armes cheefe citizen would haue vsurped hundred thereabout fully resoluing set vpon maintained fauoured forme gouernement pretending represented whole body people first brunt slewe athenian named hiperbolus wicked person bad life beene banished athens suspition feare power authoritie foule offence dishonoured city slewe also one athenian captaines called charminus certaine athenian company whose counsell hee led determined proceede farther fauour newe oligarchie citizen held popular estate hearing conspiracie discouered namely certaine captaines vnder charge diomedon leon two athenian commander receuied charge honor people content authority state men hand therfore like sort reueale thrasibulus thrasillu • one maister shippe captain • souldiors therein also souldiours whome knew bee affectioned said popular estate earnestly praying entreating suffer thēselues besotted circumuented conspirator whose purpose kill thē abandon citie samos exigent least changing forme gouernment said city till obserued loose good afterward free men athenianship time alwaies shewed themselues vtter enemy rule small number good • n opinion diomedes leon made voiage sea willingly gaue charge ship ioining citie stood poplar estate committed foure hundred informed said shippes arriuall caused two three saied parali bee taken imprisoned rest put sundrie shippes sending seuerall part eubaea surely kept saue chereas hauing vnderstood intended doe hide saue himselfe returning al speed possible samos reported athenian army done athens making euery thing greater hee said held people oppressed outraged daring speake one word gouernors iniure outrage men wiues child also besides determined like armie samos withstand take wi • e child neere kinsfolkes put death would yeeld obedien • e vnto thē sundry thing said chereas report lie wherewith souldiers incensed purposed kill onely set vp estate small number gouernours samos also consented thereunto beene told sought appease put citie daunger falling enemy handes sea great number comming assaile gaue ouer bloodie resolution yet purposing restore openly popular estate city thrasibulus thrasillus cheefe dealer herein constrained athenian armie euen also held gouernement fewe defend vttermost power popular estate followe behalfe order captaines giue withall defend said city samos peloponesians repute enemy foure hundred newe gouernours make anie agreement like oath tooke samians age beare armour whome also souldiours sware would liue die like fortune assuring themselues meanes safetie neither samians cast away estate foure hundred preuaile continue athens peloponesians take city samos force herein much time employed spent athenian souldiours armie samos sought restore popular estate athens gouernment athens constraine samians doe done souldiours assembled cause deposed cap • aines said armie suspected fauour estate foure hundred place chose others among whō thrasibulus thrasyllus exhorted souldiours one another constant resolution sundry reason shewed although city yeelded gouernement said foure hundred amongst thing shewed armie farre number remained city better furnished thing hauing hand ship sea force might inforce subiect confederate city contribute money although vtterly excluded athens yet city samos neither small weake besides city athens thus depriued power sea wherein pretended exceed city strong inough foile peloponesians came assaile samos done time also resist athens preuaile hauing shippes hand meanes whereof might alwaies bee stored victual whereas athenian feele great want thereof victual vntill time beene brought vnto vnladen hauen pyreum came helpe fauour armie samos would nowe barre vnlesse would restore vnto people gouernment city meanes said armie might better shut vp sea wholly depriue vse thereof tho • e remained athens athens could like whatsoeuer city could affoord furnish selfe least part hope thereby resist enemy losing lost nothing said citie money left souldiours enforced serue owne charge gouernors good counsell thing whereby city might keepe obedience army abroad herein greatly failed violated corrupted ancient lawes samos would maintaine enforce others obserue wherefore thing beleeued among beene author better counsell opinion herein city thing inferiour lesse aduised side would offer alcibiades restitution repeale banishment would willingly make alliance amity betweene king persia thing faile yet hauing great army sea might goe whatsoeuer place would find city land wherein inhabite reason persuasion exhorted notwithstanding vsed great diligence preparing thing necessary war ten embassador ben sent thither foure hundred vnderstood published spread abroad among people kept silence declared charge twelfth chapter book writeth thus meanwhile embassador foure hundred sent • mo returned athens reported alcibiades giuen thē charge viz looke keeping city defending themselues enemy hoped reconcile army samos likewise vanquish peloponesians word greatly incourage many said foure hundred already weary forme gouernement would willingly haue giuen ouer thought might haue done without danger al one accord vndertook ordering matter hauing guide leader speedily sent antiphon phrynichus ten others company lacedemonians giuing thē charge appoint conclude thē least disaduātage euill th •• might prouided appointmēt tollerable feare well athens samos touching wall repaired raised higher etiona said theramenes held much hinder thē samos frō entring hauē pyreum receiue enemy army sea land whē would etiona stand entrance hauē pyreū maner cressant wherfore wal built land side strengthen place power placing men either permit shippes came enter keepe place ioines tower hath entrance narrow besides reparation bestowed etiona likewise repaire old wall without pyreum sea side raised new wall within land side betweene made great hals storehouse whether enforced euery cittizen bring prouision corne hee house likewise whatsoeuer corne brought sea commandement vnladen wanted corne buy thing namely foure hundred made said reparation prouisions end receiue enemy spread abroad theramenes good last embassadours sent foure hundred lacedemon returned hauing done nothing said embassage theremenes speake openly wall made cause great daunger vnto city time came thither two forty saile enemy part whereof italian sicilian came peloponesus wit sent eubaea rest part beene left hauen ye countrey laconia whose captaine agesandridas sonne agesander lacedemonian whereupon theramenes said fell much coast prosecute voyage eubaea aid made said wall etiona good watch kept greatly bee feared would surprise pyreum speech theramenes helde altogether false spoken malice truth held oligarchie athens would faine might haue done gouerne city liberty vnder authority haue power commaund subiects city name representing body commonweale could maintaine defend authority resolued hauing hauen ship fortresse pyreum hand liue safety feared people • ecouer former estate gouernement first destroyed • ides able defend themselues rather would come people hand purposed receiue enemy pyreum yet deliuer ship fortress agree touching estate city best sort could prouided alwaies person bee safe cause kept good watch wals gate withall vsed great diligence fortifying place enemy might enter feared surprised preuented enterprise deliberation made communicated among person afterward phrynichus returned lacedemon hurt middest market place one warded whereof died soone returned thence pallace hurt fled one arginus assisted commandement foure hundred taken demanded rocke persuaded thereunto could name none said knew nothing saue captaine watch house also sundry citizen house oft great meeting reason discouery theramenes aristocrates rest faction well number foure hundred others incited enterprise much rathe • fleet ye hauing arriued day epidaurus made • excursion much harme territority aegina whereupon theramenes said wa • likely saied fleet bound eubaea would make excursion gulfe aegina returne thence epidaurus ben sent held pyreum alwaies said vpon occasion hereof many information giuen people rise last determined ye taken force according determination souldiours occupied fortification etiona whose captaine aristocrates tooke one foure hundred neuerthelesse secretly held contrary side whose name alexicles committed ward owne house vnder custody guard apprehended many amongst others one captaines keeping munichie whose name herman done consent greatest part souldiours vpon signifying thing foure hundred kept themselues within pallace towne except gouernment pleased determined put themselues armes set vpon theramenes excusing himselfe said ready goe ye apprehend made innouations deed tooke one captaines owne mind went pyrea aristarcus horseman aided whereupon rose forthwith great horrible tumult within city said plainly openly pyrea taken slain found side within pyrea supposed city came thē insomuch ancient city much ado keep citizen frō putting thēselues arm herein thucidides pharsalian took great pain hauing great friendship acquaintance many thē went pacifie thē gentle speech requiring counselling thē put city danger destruction sith enemy neare hand laie wait counsell people pacified euery man went home owne house meane space theramenes one gouernours arriued pyreum made shewe word bee angry footman well armed aristarcus band contrarie faction indeed much offended ceased labour worke farre asked theramenes whether hee thought best finish wall plucke downe answered cared plucked downe straightway wrought manie rest pyreum got vpon wall lesse houre laid flat earth hereof exhortating winning people purpose spake thus alowd stander whosoeuer rather fiue thousand gouerne foure hundred ought yeeld helpe doe doe speech vsed would haue knowne meant restore popular estate rather shewed themselues content willing fiue thousand gouerne feared least pretended haue gouernment popular estate would let speech thereof escape vnawares talked one another whereupon foure hundred greatly amased sort content vtterly disliking fiue thousand haue authority yet meant deposed popular state must need come vp againe side giuing authority vnto manner one sith power state many men hand therefore deuise declaring thing kept men feare suspition well one side next day foure hundred notwithstanding great trouble assembled pallace side armes pyreum hauing throwne downe wall released alexicles apprehended went theatre bacchus munichium within hauen pyreum held counsell hauing throughly debated euery point concluded go city set vp armour accustomed place accomplished vpon vnarmings came many citizen sent secretly foure hundred addressed themselues among knew bee tractable praying demeane themselues peaceably make trouble tumult city also keepe others telling might name altogether fiue thousand ought haue gouernment put number foure hundred office authoritie thought meete intent citie might put daunger falling enemy hand aduertisements request made sundrie men diuerse place seuerall personage people armour well pacified fearing least controuersie would turne destruction city insomuch agreed vpon men generall assembly certaine day held temple bacchus thirteenth chapter b • ok writeth thus athenian vpon vnderstanding newes feare necessity soeuer armed notwithstanding twentie shippes presently assembled place pyreum place call pycue wherin time accustomed assemble assembly concluded foure hundred deposed authority remaine hand fiue thousand number might bee could bear armour would serue office without wage whosoeuer otherwise accursed many assembly followed diuerse lawes ordinance made touching gouernment gommonweale beginning mine opinion effectually performed many thinges direction common affaire welfare city reducing controuersie occasion popular particular gouernment amongst good mediocritie caused surceassing many naughty thing cōmitted city also maintenance said city commonweale thus may see thucidides hath truly grauely written concerning trouble alteration gouernmēt athens thought good insert place though somewhat long well giue reader greater light vnderstanding aristotle obseruations themselues short darke shew vse skil gouernment specially excellent historiographer commonweale soueraigne magistrate vnto cheefe hardest matter referred changed euery two month nobleman intruded themselues authoritie gouernement people reason could endure great pride soone take armes tooke commonweale intent gainesay resist aduersaries people resist nobility also popular sort deuided commoner called nobleman odious name mightie fellowes deuided people two order placing one rich men might attaine magistracy poore exercised base occupation excluded gouernment distributing people consisted two twentie company occupation whereof seuen called greater might bee admitted gouernment honest worshipfull fifteene stood ciphre publicke gouernment notwithstanding greatest number sorrie see themselues depriued honour attempted oft obtaine force armes denied vnto lawes statute commonweale ioining themselues popular sort neerest order part superiours maisters creation election publicke office whereto aduanced partaker thrust nobleman many attaine thereunto put themselues matter cheefe magistrate propounded parliament established kinde gouernment vnder name popular gouernement tended power person men generall though came anie great number citizen yet aduise counsell enclined forme gouernment large popular taken effect beene frier ierome sauonarola iacobite hauing gottē name authority prophet openly detested found fault forme deliberating parliament affirmed god ordained gouernement altogethes popular rest power citizen change libertie safetie others therefore matter often debated last determined counsell created citizen whereinto scumme people receiued onely ancient lawes city might admitted gouernment counsell nothing bee treated disposed sauing election magistrate city possession reuenues confirmation prouision money lawes aforetime ordained magistrate straighter counsel nowe consultation one day forme said gouernement betweene cheefe magistrate person greatest reputation two contrary oration made one paule anthony soderin spake democratie guy anthonie vespucci vpheld oligarchie fit vnderstanding present matter shall bee set downe therefore paule anthonie soderin began maner although popular state lesse esteemed wherein matter bee referred one alone gouerned according aduise vpright honest men yet notwithstanding desire libertie auncient thing welneere naturall city condition citizen proportioned equalitie verie necessary foundation popular gouernments could easily shew without manner doubt ought preferre al others kind disputation superfluous forasmuch latter assembly hath alwaies ben determined general consent citie gouerned name authority people hence came diuersitie opinion matter ordained parliament haue voluntarily condiscended forme commonweale whereby citie gouerned libertie oppressed house medici others whose number confesse selfe bee one reason iudge kind gouernment thus ordained containe many matter rather name effect popular gouernment afeard knowing accident haue often growne kind gouernement doe desire perfecter forme whereby concord safetie citizen may preserued thing cannot hoped citie anie reason experience time past except vnder gouernment wholly depending people authority wel duly ordained ruled cheefely grounded two foundation first whereof magistracy office well citie territorie giuen certaine time vniuersal counsell lawes may gouernours without allowance counsell shall lawfull make new lawes meanes hereof shall rest power priuate citizen particular conspiracie confederacie distribute dignity authority man shall bee barred another man fancie shall distributed according men vertues desert therfore euery man must endeuour prepare way honour vertues good manner aiding publicke state men priuately shall necessary euery man abstaine vice hurting men finally thing hatefull well ordered citie neither shall lie power one bring gouernment new lawes authoritie magistrate gouernment cannot altered without consent vniuersall counsel second foundation consultation determination touching matter importance namely concerne peace warres examining newe lawes generally thing necessarie gouernment citie dominion ordered directed magistrate especially authorised charge office priu • er counsell wise experienced citizen shall appointed coū sell people euery man fit hearing determining matter capable ought haue gouerning thereof sith often require diligence secrecie may consulted determined multitude • necessary preseruation libertie matter treated verie great companie sufficient assuring city libertie distributing magistracy determining newe lawes depend vniuersal consent matter prouided gouernment perfectly popular remaineth ordained libertie citie founded commendable durable forme commonweale confirmed diuerse matter bettering gouernment whereof wee speake shall bee reserued fitter time beginning trouble mind mē suspitious doubtfull remembrance tyrannie past acquainted ordering free gouernments cannot perfectly perceiue necessarie ordained preseruation libertie matter great importance may without danger referred till fitter time better occasion citizen daily grow liking forme gouernment practise become capable wil desirous continually amend bring full perfection mean time shalbe vpheld ij foundation mentioned easie ordained shewing fruit wil come therof reason also exāples though gouernment venetian belong gentlemē yet priuat citizen number diuerse degree cannot denied contains great part popular gouernment cannot imitated many thing notwithstanding cheefly laid ij foundation commonweale leaning staying hath space many age maintained liberty vnity ciuile concord mounted glory high estate vnity venetian hath proceeded frō scituation city many men suppose may haue ben sometimes discord amongst thē rather frō form gouernment wel ordained proportioned selfe necessitie yeelds excellent wonderful effect must consider contrary reason citie neuer like forme gouernment therefore affaire haue euermore subiect ordinarie alteration one oppressed violence tyrans another rent asunder ambitious couetous discord certaine person quickly broken peeces vnbridled licentiousnesse comminaltie whereas city builded tranquilitie happie life inhabitant confiscation land good banishment beheading vnhappie citizen haue beene hap tranquilitie haue gouernment brought parliament doth differ kind gouernment time haue ben citie haue ben full discord calamity endlesse broiles publicke priuat haue last engendred tyranny duke athens time ancestor oppressed libertie occasion cosmus de medici time following whereat need meruel whē bestowing magistracy determining law need cōmon consent depend le • er number citizen intentiue careful common welfare priuat desire purpose follow particular faction conspiracy whereunto diuisions al city ioined certain pestilence death al cōmonweales empire much thē standeth wisdome shun formes gouernment reason others example may know pernicious dangerous take form behoofeful happy speech wil freely vtter gouernment alwaies ordained city sort citizen therein haue vnmeasurable authority gouernment tyrans much dangerous one tyran alone euil much worse much cōmitted multiplied though inconuenience yet least reason diuersity opinion ambition variable desire mē long agreement could therein hoped discord al time dangerous time perillous wherin haue sent mighty lord exile wherein depriued good part state wherin italy hauing strange army within bowel fully laid open great danger sildome yea may neuer hath laine absolutely power whole city take order self according hir good pleasure therfore sith benignity goodnesse god hath deliuered power hand lose oportunity founding free gouernement well ordained liues may make happy also may promise euerlasting continuance leaue inheritance childrē successor treasure felicity neither selues ancestor euer knew speech paule anthonie cōtrary guy anthonie vespucci spake thus gouernement established forme paule anthonie soderin hath propounded would easily bring forth desir • fruit rehearsed doubtlesse hee haue wonderfull euill tast countrey would wish gouernment bad citizen would greatly loue forme commonweale wherein men vertues desert valour aboue thing bee respected honoured howbeit see wee may hope gouernement resting wholly people power fraught manie commodity knowe well reason teacheth experience proueth authoritie great men confirmeth great multitude wisedome experience order found wise preferred ignorant good bad men experience neuer gouernement anie affaire vpright iudgements cannot bee hoped hand vnfit ignorant iudge euen wise reasonable election determination hoped hand people full disorder ignorance wise men scantly descerne spend time nothing else shall wee beleeue multitude rude ignorant consisting great diuersities mind condition manner wholly regarding concerneth selfe particularly distinguish perceiue omit speake immoderate persuasion euerie one haue himselfe cause men greedie desire honour neither suffice men popular gouernement enioy honest fruit libertie aspire principall degree haue place deliberation important hard matter modestie giuing place skilfullest best deseruing person reigneth lesse citie entring persuasion right ought equall thing rowmes vertue valour power multitude shall bee confounded greedie desire extending part bee occasion knowe least least deserue shall bee able doe reason greatest number wil haue power state opinion shal accounted weighed considered warrant assurance haue holding themselues content forme would haue ordained straightway fall troubling state commonweale hath beene wisely brought new inuentions imprudent lawes wise men shall able withstand thing time dangerous kind commonweale feared present sith nature men passe one extremitie wherein haue forcibly kept leape wilfully another without staying meane hee commeth tyrannie vnlesse held backe falleth headlong manner excessiue licentiousnesse may also iustly called tyrannie people like vnto tyran giue deserueth take deserueth confound degree difference person may bee tyrannie thereof hurtful ignorance daungerous forasmuch hath neither weight measure law disordered naughtinesse neither ought example venetian moue v scituation citie worketh somewhat behalfe forme gouernment receiued great since may doe much matter ordained deliberation importance hand manie wit peraduenture naturally fine subtile easily contented yet venetian gouernement standeth onely vpon two foundation haue beene alledged greatly auaileth perfection stabilitie thereof euermore duke together diuerse ordinance whosoeuer intended bring commonweale find many gainsayers reason citie dooth instant take institution establishment lawes respect contempt men perceiue themselues sufficient power attaine purpose making account danger reason power easily enterprise general army monarch cyrus astiages despising life power army corrupted sea carrie himselfe men may acknowledge action certaine maiestie noblenesse heart grauitie constancie causing thing specially concerne perticular matter subiects sentence may stand irreuocable decree maintaine himselfe reputation men feare go deceaue prince procureth estimation himselfe cannot faile greatly feared redoubted hardly man attempt conspire neither shall bee easily assailed knoweth lord valiaunt honoured obeied people therefore necessarie cause feare name two place one within owne countrie regard subiects forraine country regard strange potentate whome hee shall defend himselfe good munition good friend ally confederats wil neuer faile vse good order gouernment owne force forraigne matter go well forward domesticall cause remaine good state vnlesse secrete conspiracie home whereat arbactus offended great number men wearing armour obeied woman dealt wooll disclosed seene fellowes lieutenant prouinces whome declared would neuer obey kind man rather woman man hereby stirre vp one accord made warres knowledge hereof came sardanapalus sought man doe defend kingdome woman doe place might hide head notwithstanding within short time perceaued himselfe driuen came foorth men without order battel immediatly ouercome withdrew himselfe roial palace wherin caused pile wood made set rich vpon causing fire put vnder performing thing mās act death arbactus made king stead manner strumpet shewing himselfe lasciuious woman themselues counterfeited speech according imitation likenesse desired haue daily food meat drinke might prouoke lightnesse also gaue himselfe wholly doe good doe loue flatter also wicked profitable wickednesse one naile driueth another prouerbe also point tyranny take pleasure graue free person tyran himselfe need seeme alone bee kinde man whosoeuer contrary side vseth grauity freenesse taketh away excellencie maisterlike authority tyranny therefore tyrans hate manner men destroyer estate likewise • feast banquet stranger citizeens point tyranny one enemy aduersaries like thing tyrannicall doe preserue tyranny neuerthelesse full wickednesse meanes may maner comprised three • sith tyran doth aime cheefly three thing first subiects haue neither courage knowledge cowardly ignorant men neuer conspire second mutual distrust among tyranny destroyed vnlesse doe repose confidence cause tyrans enemy good vertuous men may endammage estate vsed like slaues also loyall faithfull betweene themselues others doe accuse either themselues third point subiects haue power meanes execute thing sith commonly men doe vndertake thing impossible none seeke destroy tyranny haue power doe three end whereto tyrans purpose tend al tyrans enterprise may reduced supposition subiects distrust haue power coward ignorant first manner preseruing tyrannicall state manner hath contrary consideration thing aforesaid may bee gathered destruction kingdomes kingly state destroyed becomming tyrannicall tyranny preserued approching neare manner fashion kingdome retaining still force power command willingly obey also doe vnwillingly sith loosing force looseth name state tyran foundation presupposed assured must partly vse manner fashion also partly seeme vse making thus fayre outward shew good kingly gouernement first cheefly must faine himselfe carefull publicke good state vse expences may offend people wast prodigally reuenues treasure citie strumpet stranger player giue account money receiued employed tyrans former time haue done shall bee accounted good husband commonweale tyran need feare want mony time lord city good profitable tyrans goe abroad expedition vrgent affaire rather want leaue treasure hoorded vp meanes deputed appointed guard keeping countrey absence attempt lesse certaine feared citizen citizen goe tyrans remaine home moreouer touching imposition tax subsidy must carry himselfe therein hee seeme leuie maintenance state employ money therby gathered preparing prosecuting warre neede shall require hee must make outward shew men may esteeme keeper treasurer pablicke mony owne must also seeme austere graue behauior shall haue occasion speake vnto may feare rather reuerence thing hee hardly doe contemptible therefore although tyran make account vertues yet least ought haue requisite gouernour cause opinion con ••• ued also whole traine seruants offer iniury subiects neither boy girle woman doe like sort demeane themsel • e towards woman many tyranny haue beene destroyed reason iniuries woman haue offered touching bodily pleasure hee must order himselfe cleane otherwise tyrans adaies doe sufficeth follow delight morning night continue many day night together also haue men knowe liue may haue admirati •• fortunate happy men let moderately vse pleasure least let see • e others one make account sh •• sober cannot easily surprised contemned drunkard may neither watchfull sleepy person must doe cleane contrary thing mentioned beautifying adorning city • guardian procurer good therof tyran must make shew loue aboue thing god religion subiects stand lesse feare sustaining wrong oppression prince thinke religious feare god likewise lesse conspire suppose god doe loue fauor must seeme manner person without suspition wickednesse moreouer must honour aduance good men excell thing may haue cause thinke might receiue greater honor aduancement owne citizen liued liberty besides let tyran himselfe bestow honor men inflict punishment others officer iudges yet farther common precept maintaining preseruing euery kind monarchie make man ouergreat least aduance one watch haue eye fall must raise one let chuse one haughty audatious person boldly attempt thing soeuer likewise find requisite depriue one credite authority must doe little little take power besides hee must abstaine kind iniury especially two sort one beating folke dishonouring youth filthy lust wherof must take great heed towards ambitious couetous person doe take greeuously iniury offered taking away good either ambitious good men doe like losse honour wherefore punishment bee vsed el inflicted according law custome country contempt reproch chance conuerse youth said let doe loue tyrannicall liberty least doe dishonour let recompence greater honour amongst conspire tyrans person purpose kill must feare take great heed care owne liues may rid life must cheefly dread thinke iniury hath ben offered either themselues person hold dearest despight anger attempt thing haue neither feare carewhat becomes themselues according heraclitus saying hard thing fight anger cost man life whereas city consist two part namely poore men rich men must prouided part thinke safety preseruation depend estate must great heed taken wrong hurt thing let haue stronger side stirre arise bee enforced enfranchise slaues take citizen armour weapon one two part ioined owne power sufficient resist part assaile superfluous prosecute thinges particularly sith intention aime thereof manifest hee must referre action end subiects may esteeme tyran steward king one applieth owne peculiar profit publicke good state guardian thereof obserue meane life giuen excesse vsing familiarity nobleman gratifying people meanes shall doubtlesse make state gouernment fairer desirable raigneth ouer better subiects seruile abiect person himselfe shall either hated feared also longer continuance finally must fram • •• fashion manner halfe vertuous good bad halfe bad cause destroy kingdomes tyranny declared according former methode cause also set downe doe preserue maintaine first generally vpheld meanes contrary cause ruines kingdome lesse tyrannicall absolute tyranny approch neerer kingly state said tyranny also preserued maintained two manner one rigorous moderate rigorous manner referred seuere rather cruell act tyrans wont doe respecting onelie owne safetie profite suppresse much may bee notable person make away haue stout courage forbid subiects vse banquet schooles studie idle meeting thing breed haughtinesse heart mutuall confidence keepe knowing throughly knowledge causeth greater trust faithfulnesse betweene haue forraine souldiours shewing themselues street walking vp downe citti • en house thereby strike terror keepe continuall feare haue spy priuie hearkeners euery corner cittie may discouer report whatsoeuer shall therein done said likewise vse meanes friend may falsely accuse liue discord vulgar sort nobleman rich men betweene themselues impouerish haue alwaies busied end wealth idlenesse may conspire troubled warre may alwaies haue need leader cheefetaine kingdome preserued vpheld friend tyrannie doth altogether distrust friend therefore giueth great libertie woman slaues lord tyrans must wise haue neere graue freeminded men person doe diminish lordly excellence authority tyran himselfe alone seeme bee accounted kinde man likewise hee banquet let doe stranger citizen meanes tyranncall reduced three point first subiects bee cowardly ignorant second distrust third haue power meanes conspire three thing pernicious gathered aristotle allow instruct men rather may beware knowing miserie tyrans constrained serue turnes euils thereby assure person estate machiauel florence writing prince hath taken place part precept adding thereunto romane italian example nowe almost meanes haue relation first manner preseruing vpholding tyranny full seueritie rigour manner contrarie former gentle moderate tyran imitate gouernement kingly state prouided hee haue alwayes power wherby may command ouer voluntarily subiect thing king doth also ouer doe vnwillingly obey hee must feine haue great care publicke good state vse prodigality therby offend people seeme tyran steward lord common treasure bestower keeper thereof austere haughtie graue ciuile hee must likewise beware none traine doe iniurie one especially woman vse outragious insolent demeanure toward woman must moderately vse pleasure aboue thing make shew louing god religion hee must honour aduance good men excell thing himselfe bestow reward inflict punishment others officer iudges tyran hath common king make man ouergreat el aduaunce many end may haue eye raise haughty audacious men vsually prompt forward attempt thing hee hath raised hee find requisite pull downe must doe little little taking credite power hee must abstaine outrage especially beating dishonouring youth filthy lust doe must seem rather loue tyrannical liberty whereas city consist rich poore commonly wel agree maintaine thē friendly togither hauing strongest alwaies side helpe hee may bee able resist others assault familiar nobleman gratifie people framing manner hee bee good halfe good bad halfe bad aristotle seemeth haue beene curious setting downe tyrannicall meanes sith euill prince sufficiently inclined themselues inuent serue maintaining high estate safety needful instruct bookes machiauel fashioning prince hath fetched hence haue alleadged principall ground institution must bee red great discretion written authour without conscience without religion respecting onely worldly power glorie deceiueth many men purpose set forth nothing wee thought would serue honour god ferri neque mutari ac misceri omnia cerneres nam imperium facile artibus retinetur quibus initio partum est verum vbi pro labore desidia pro continentia aequitate libido atque superbia inuasere fortuna simul cum moribus immutatur ita imperium semper ad optimum quemque à minus bono transfertur idem alibi sepè ego cum animo meo reputans quibus quisque rebus clarissimi viri magnitudinem viz beeause people therein inducing follow husbandry certaine lawes • ncient time vsed many profitable suffer man haue land according certaine measure quantity el certaine place citie anciently speake • although many possesse small territory yet husbandman let whole possession diuide many part poore also may exceed reuenues next multitude husbandman best sort people sheepeheards liue cattell agree many thing husbandman profession exercise grow fit warres haue body hardened liue continue open aire without seeking couert almost kind people whereof democracy consist worse liues bad vertue exercise mechanicall mercenary men vse buying selling besides sort people daily market place city therefore easily assistant present publicke assembly husbandman scattered abroad country doe assemble themselues neither haue need thereof scituation place country • arre distant citie easie establish good democracie commonweale multitude constrained make colony field therefore although great number city keepe haunt shop market yet cannot assemble themselues without dwell country sith haue declared best first kind democracie constituted may easily vnderstood kind established men proceed therein following manner separating remoouing alwaies worse sort people touching last kind democracie communicated cannot bee endured euerie citie bee easily preserued vnlesse bee established good lawes customes wee haue shewed • ore almost corruption destroy forme commonweale formes establish democracie make people thereof mightie haue knowledge matter gouernment haue beene accustomed receaue thereinto many men could make citizen lawfully borne bastard also whose father mother citizen sith fit kind • eople guide leader people haue thus taken order yet must receiue many number vulgar sort may exceed noble meane estate must passe exceed much trouble commonweale cause nobility democracie conceiue disliking discontent wherevpon sedition cyrene raised men make accouut small inconuenience chap iiii commodity requisit establishing good kind gouernment happy city greatnesse city bvt sith haue premised thing disputed • ore cōmonweales speake rem • ines first shew ground requisite haue cōstituting city mē might desire possible establish commonweale without hauing different measure thing thereto expedient needfull must therefore presuppose sundry commodity wishing whereof neuerthelesse none impossible meane multitude citizen greatnesse territory euen artificer embroderer shipwright must haue stuffe meet worke much better much fairer better peece worke bee made thereof like sort gouernour lawmaker must haue proper matter well conueniently prepared first commoditie hereunto requisite multitude inhabitant many nature ought likewise regard must bee territory bigge kind soile must bee many suppose happie flourishing city bee great bee true know citie great small iudge bee great reason number multitude inhabitant whereas rather respect power multitude certaine duty worke proper citie citie best performe ought bee accounted great say hippocrates greater man greater phisition another man may exceed greatnesse body yet men iudging greatnesse citie respect number inhabitant must haue regard euery multitude men necessity city great number slaues stranger haue regard part thereof whome consisteth proper member abundance dooth witnesse greatnesse citie citie affoord many artificer fewe souldiours cannot b • e great difference betweene great populous citie knowne experience bee difficult rather impossible citie much peopled bee well gouerned certes city whose gouernement accounted good wee see populous hereof reason selfe dooth assure v lawe certaine order good instituting lawes necessitie good order excessive number inhabitant capable order worke requiring god omnipotent power comprehendeth gouerneth globe whole world sith goodnesse fairenesse dooth vsually consist multitude greatnesse citie wherein prescribed proportion greatnesse doubtlesse best fairest also certaine measure greatnesse city thing liuing creature plant instrument small excessiue greatnesse cannot retaine power shall thereby wholly loose nature remaine vnprofitable shippe hand breadth deed shippe also two furlong come greatnesse either little excessiue highnesse saile ill like sort citie hath inhabitant sufficient although citie bee thing sufficient haue many inhabitant shall bee furnished thing necessary nation citie neither possible gouerne well could bee guide leader huge multitude crier vnlesse hee like stentor wherefore bee accounted cheefest citie hath number may suffice first principally selfe liue well ciuile societie although citie may bee greater exceeding proportion yet infinite hath said easie vnderstand effect themselues tearme bound excesse action citie sometimes commanding sometimes obeying authoritie commandement iudgement action commander nowe iudge vprightlie bestow magistracy worthie person necessarie citizen doe knowe good oligarchy monarchy equall euen place democracy neither aristocracy rather requisite haue state many strong place touching priuat house form held pleasant meet respect whē well framed built af • er modern fashion deuised hippodamus greater surety war shal better haue thē built contrary maner ancient time meanes stranger cannot without difficulty danger come vnto assailant entangled wind themselues shall therfore good vse therein formes thing may done dispose husbandman arbor vine make city penetrable certain part place shal requisit safety beautifying therof touching wals affirm city honor imbrace vertue vse speak simply ancient maner plainly see experience hath controlled error city therein glory boast grant honor defending thēselues help wals either like much exceed number possible sometimes doth fal humane prowesse valor person cannot resist thē wil saue themselues destroied outraged must hold strength wals assured profitable war especially time wherein many engine assaulting besieged place haue ben denised enclose city wals much lay open country roades inuasions enemy pull lay leuell highest place much wal priuat house least dwel therein become coward likewise ignorant inhabitant city inclosed wals may vse two manner wals none thing city vnwalled cannot thē wals built round also order takē may serue ornament city necessary occasion war wel subtlety moderne deuises assailant doe meanes seeke preuaile meanes already found must sought inuented defence citie commonly men enterprise war prepared furnished chusing place fit building city regard must scituation thereof may stand commodiously land sea wholesomenesse aire wind commeth towards sunne cheefely easterly next northerly wind likewise suretie place may easily besieged approch thereunto painefull enemy salies issue easie citizen whereof hath alreadie spoken fift sixt chapter booke aboue thing wel furnished within running wholesome water greatly health least cesternes therein keepe commodity great prosperity thibron seemeth praise lacedemonians lawgiuer doth also whosoeuer el hath written commonweale long exercised enured peril warfare haue greatly extended enlarged dominion sith doe longer beare rule certain likewise longer happy lawgiuer good besides ridiculous obseruing still lawes way hindered vsing haue lost happy life neither doe iudge well bearing rule whereof lawgiuer seeme make great account commanding gouerning free men better hath vertue therin lordly kind ruling furthermore citie thought happy lawgiuer praised doth exercise subduing neighbour borderer
